Entries.default: A shaft of light breaks through the splintered roof of the Oratory of Wael to illuminate an empty pedestal.
Though it's sometimes hard to tell in the Hall of the Unseen, it's daytime. Motes of dust hover in the glow of the sun.
Though it's sometimes hard to tell in the Hall of the Unseen, it's nighttime. The beam is tinged with silver from the glow of distant stars.
The skin of your palm prickles with comforting warmth.
It's oddly cool and refreshing to the touch.
The light shines down on blank parchment and dim runes. Nothing else happens.
You rest the book on the pedestal, bathing its cover and binding in cool starlight.

Bekarna's grimoire twitches with anxious, pent-up energy. The book snaps open, its pages suddenly laid bare to the starry sky.

Blank parchment fill with text as if by an unseen hand, and runes once faded flare to brilliance. The grimoire pulses with energy before going still, its pages ruffled by an ethereal breeze.
